alert.note: Alert for Wallowa (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 10:53PM PDT until May 10 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Imnaha River at Imnaha affecting Wallowa County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Imnaha River...including Imnaha...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, MAY 10... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Imnaha River at Imnaha. * WHEN...Until Wednesday, May 10. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 5.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 5.7 feet late tonight. It will then oscillate around flood stage through Thursday before rising above flood stage to 6.4 feet Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage again Wednesday, May 10. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.4 feet on 05/15/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
